properties.entry: Export as a standalone jar-based game
Show set items references by default
Show start dialog the next time
To start using the <e-Adventure> editor, you must choose between creating a new adventure, or opening an existing one to edit it.

Welcome to the <e-Adventure> editor! To get started using the editor you must choose between the options prompted here. You can create a new file by clicking on the button you can find below. You are allowed to create two different type of adventure games (this choice can be modified later): - Adventures where the player is shown normally, as for instance, the MonkeyIslandTM saga (3rd person mode). - Adventures where the player is not shown, giving the impression that the user is directly inside the game, as in the Myst saga (1st person mode).
If you do not want to create a new adventure project, you can open an existing one by browsing the tabs above.
You have selected to create a new adventure in 3rd person mode (player is visible).
You have selected to create a new adventure in 1st person mode (player is not shown).

You have selected to create a new Adaptation file. For the present release this option is unavailable. You must create the adaptation file by opening/creating a new adventure game; then use the facility therein included

You have selected to create a new Assessment file. For the present release this option is unavailable. You must create the assessment file by opening/creating a new adventure game; then use the facility therein included
Do not show this dialog again
When reading the chapter "{#1}" the next problem was found: {#0}. Please, select what to do: 1) Delete the chapter, 2) Replace it with other file, 3) Abort process.
An error occurred replacing the chapter. The operation was aborted.
Error: Reference to a not existing asset
The file "{#0}" was not found. All the references to the resource were deleted.
Error: The assessment profile was not found
There are references to the next assessment profile: "{#0}", which does not exist. All the references to the profile were deleted.
Error: The adaptation profile was not found
There are references to the next adaptation profile: "{#0}", which does not exist. All the references to the profile were deleted.
Sorry, but the move player effect is not supported for the current adventure mode.
The assessment file "{#0}" was not found.
The adaptation file "{#0}" was not found.
The background asset "{#0}" was not found.
The animation asset "{#0}" was not found.
The image asset "{#0}" was not found.
The icon asset "{#0}" was not found.
The audio asset "{#0}" was not found.
The video asset "{#0}" was not found.
The cursor asset "{#0}" was not found.
The styled text asset "{#0}" was not found.
An error occurred with the XML consistency of the adventure descriptor file
An error occurred reading the adventure descriptor file
An error occurred with the XML consistency of the adventure data
An error occurred reading the data
An error occurred with the XML consistency of the assessment data
An error occurred reading the assessment data
An error occurred processing an assessment profile which is referenced in the adventure
An error occurred with the XML consistency of the adaptation data
An error occurred reading the adaptation data
An error occurred processing an adaptation profile which is referenced in the adventure
An unexpected error occurred when deleting the contents of the folder.
The name of the folder is not correct. Remember you can only use characters from the list below: {#0}.
A critical error occurred loading the files. Maybe the file descriptor.xml is missing or unreadable. The load process was aborted
An error occurred when copying the file {#0} to {#1}
There has been an error loading the data. There could be an error with the format of the adventure, or the files \"descriptor.dtd\" or \"eadventure.dtd\" could be missing
There has been an error loading the assessment file. There could be an error with the format of the file, or the file \"assessment.dtd\" could be missing
There has been an error loading the adaptation file. There could be an error with the format of the file, or the file \"adaptation.dtd\" could be missing
There has been an error writing the data, please check that the information is correct, and report the error to the development team

The special asset "{#0}" can't be found and won't be added in the adventure. Please make sure that this file is included in the editor, as the lack of this file could lead to malfunction of the adventures
An error occurred when creating the assessment file
An error occurred when creating the adaptation file
An error occurred when creating the folder
The file "{#0}" was not copied to the project (maybe the file is corrupt or not present). This could provoke errors when executing the adventure with the game engine.
The file "{#0}" was not found. This could provoke errors when executing or loading the adventures.
The image could not be loaded, possible because the image type is not completly supported.
This video has a unsupported format. Please, try to convert this video file to one of next codecs: MPEG 1 video, DivX 5 (or lower), MS-MPEG 4 V2 or XVID.
There aren't variables in this chapter. Please, create one before try to use variables here
There aren't flags in this chapter. Please, create one before try to use flags here
Are you sure you want to change the current mode? However, you can revert to the old mode by performing the same operation, and no data will be lost.
Type the name of the new folder
Operation: Exporting project as Learning Object
Operation: Exporting project as Standalone game (.JAR)
Operation: Exporting project as EAD game (.EAD)
Set the rest of the animations?
There are no other animations set for this character. Do you want to set them with this animation asset as well?
Are you sure you want to delete it? The data will be lost
The project has unsaved changes. Do you want to save those changes before creating the new data?

Select the folder project. You can select one of the existing or create a new one. Nonetheless the name of the folder can only contain the next characters: {#0}. Folders with names containing other characters will not be valid.

The selected directory is not empty. Do you want to delete the contents of the folder? (The data will be lost). If the folder is not empty, please check that it does not contain any files named 'descriptor.xml' or 'chapterXX.xml' where XX is a number.
Sorry, but a project folder cannot be contained in the restriccted directory "web"
The folder does not exist yet. Do you want to create it?
The file has unsaved changes. Do you want to save those changes before loading the new data?
The project was not successfully loaded
An error occurred and the project was not successfully saved
The adventure project has unsaved changes. Do you want to save them before continue?
The selected file "{#0}" it's not empty. If you choose to save the adventure with this name, the previous data will be overwritten. Are you sure that you want to store the adventure in this file?
The project has unsaved changes. Do you want to save those changes before exit?
The adventure is inconsistent and will be unplayable with the <e-Adventure> engine Please perform a "Adventure consistency check" and solve the problems
The adventure is completely consistent and can be played in the <e-Adventure> engine
The adventure is inconsistent and will be unplayable until the following errors are solved:
The indispensable asset "{#0}" is not linked to an asset
The paragraph has no image attached
The page has no source text file attached
The "Play animation" effect has no animation attached
The "Play sound" effect has no sound clip attached
The conversation has an options node with no options
Input the title for the new chapter
Are you sure that you want to delete this chapter? It will be impossible to recover it after deleting
You can't delete the last chapter Every adventure must have at least one chapter
There are no set items in the adventure
Type an identifier for the new scene
Type an identifier for the new cutscene
Type an identifier for the new book
Type an identifier for the new item
Type an identifier for the new set item
Type an identifier for the new global state
Type an identifier for the new macro
Type an identifier for the new character
Type an identifier for the new conversation
Select a scene to link with the "Next scene" structure
There must be at least one scene or cutscene to create a "Next scene" element
You can't add a new exit to the scene without attaching a "Next scene" element to it
Select the item you want to add to the scene
There must be at least one item in the chapter to place a reference
Select the set item you want to add to the scene
There must be at least one set item in the chapter to place a reference
Select the character you want to add to the scene
There must be at least one character in the chapter to place a reference
Select the conversation you want to link with the character
There must be at least one conversation in the chapter to place a reference
Type an identifier for the new assessment rule
The last look can not be deleted
The last "Next scene" of the exit can not be deleted You can however delete the parent "Exit" element
Type a new identifier to rename the scene
Type a new identifier to rename the cutscene
Type a new identifier to rename the book
Type a new identifier to rename the item
Type a new identifier to rename the set item:
Type a new identifier to rename the global state
Type a new identifier to rename the macro
Type a new identifier to rename the character
Type a new identifier to rename the conversation
Are you sure you want to rename the adaptation file?
Are you sure you want to rename the assessment file?
Type the new name of the adaptation file
Type the new name of the assessment file
The name of the file cannot contain slashes or back slashes
The element "{#0}" have {#1} references in the chapter, all these references will be deleted along with the element. Are you sure that you want to delete it?
The element "{#0}" have {#1} references in the chapter. Are you sure that you want to rename it?
Cannot delete the last scene of the chapter. All chapters must have at least one scene or cutscene
The identifier must contain no blank spaces
The input identifier is already in use
The identifier "{#0}" is reserved for internal purposes
The first character of an identifier must be a letter
Are you sure you want to edit the adaptation file? Then you will move to the "Adaptation mode". Later on you can return to the current mode and continue editing the adventure by using the menu bar
Are you sure you want to edit the assessment file? Then you will move to the "Assessment mode". Later on you can return to the current mode and continue editing the adventure by using the menu bar
Please, select or create a valid adaptation file before
Please, select or create a valid assessment file before
Are you sure you want to create a new assessment file?
Name of the new assessment file
Type the name of the new assessment file
Are you sure you want to create a new adaptation file?
Name of the new adaptation file
Type the name of the new adaptation file
The selected file exists. Overwrite it?
The selected file exists. Overwrite it?
Type the new id for the assessment rule
The export process was successfully completed.

Sorry, but the exported file cannot be created in a folder contained nor in the Project Home Directory, nor in the "web" directory, which use is restricted. Please, try it again with other destiny directory.
An error occurred when exporting the project and the file was not created.
Select the name of the learning object
Please, select a name for the learning object. Do not confuse it with the name of the file: the name of the learning object will be used only by the LMS
Error: the name is not valid
The name of the learning object is not valid. It must not contain blank spaces, nor be blank
Error: the credentials provided are not valid
The author name and organization provided must be at least 6 characters long
Do not confuse the name of the Learning Object with the name of the file: the name of the learning object will be used only by the LMS internally
For security reasons, the contents of the learning object must to be digitally signed. For that purpose, please provide your full name and the name of your organization
The applet runs inside the browser
The assessment and adaptation profile must be SCORM 1.2 if they exists.
The assessment and adaptation profile must be SCORM 2004 if they exists.
The assessment and adaptation profile must be SCORM 2004 if they exists to export in AGREGA format.
This type of GUI is much like the earlier adventures of LucasArts. The user has a set of buttons to perform actions, and an inventory in the lower part of the screen

This type of GUI is much like the latest adventures of LucasArts. The actions are displayed in front of the object, when the user selects them. Also, the inventory is not visible everytime, so the user can bring it up whenever he wants
The adventure appears in a window on top of the users desktop
The adventure appears in a window with the rest of the screen in black (the users desktop is hidden)
The adventure uses all the screen realstate available on the system
You must create a flag before you can use it
The asset "{#0}" have {#1} references in the adventure, all these references will be deleted along with the asset. Are you sure that you want to delete it?
The asset "{#0}" is already in this category. Do you want to overwrite it?
The file "{#0}" can't be added to the background assets. The minimun dimensions for a background are 800x400 pixels, whilst the file's are {#1}x{#2}
The file "{#0}" can't be added to the icon assets. The dimensions for an icon are 80x48 pixels, whilst the file's are {#1}x{#2}
A flag or variable with such name already exists. Please type another name.
Variable or flag names cannot contain white spaces

This is the list of flags of the chapter. Flags can be active or inactive at any moment in the game, as traffic lights can be green or red to allow or forbid crossing. In the game you can define conditions based on the state of the flags.
Please specify the name of the new flag
To delete a flag, it must have no references
The input flag specified is already in use
The input flag identifier must contain no white spaces
This is the list of variables of the chapter. Variables can be given an integer value at any moment in the game. In the game you can define conditions based on the value of the variables.
Please specify the name of the new variable
To delete a variable, it must have no references
The input variable specified is already in use
The input variable identifier must contain no white spaces
The name you typed is very similar to other(s). Do you really want to create it? Otherwise you can select one of those found similar from the list.
The name you typed is very similar to other(s). Do you really want to create it? Otherwise you can select one of those found similar from the list.
Select the type of condition and then the fields appropriate for such type.

When the same group of conditions are going to be used together more than once it is better to define them as "Global States". Then you can refer to them in any conditions block without introducing all the conditions again.
This is the list of variables of the chapter. Variables can be given an integer value at any moment in the game. In the game you can define conditions based on the value of the variables.

This is the list of flags of the chapter. Flags can be active or inactive at any moment in the game, as traffic lights can be green or red to allow or forbid crossing. In the game you can define conditions based on the state of the flags.
To add a condition, there must be at least one flag in the chapter
Use the buttons to add, delete and move effects. You can edit them by double clicking
Select the type of effect you want to add
Select the flag to be activated
Select the flag to be deactivated
Select the variable and the value to be set
Select the variable and the increment
Select the variable and the decrement
Select the macro to launch at this point
Sorry, but there are no available macros to select. Please remember that you cannot make any reference to a macro in its definition
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one flag in the chapter
Select a character to move, and the destination point
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one character in the chapter
Select a destination point to move the player
Select the item to be consumed
Select the item to be generated
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one item in the chapter
Select an animation and a destination to play it
Select a sound file to be played
Select the character you want to speak, and the line he must say
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one character in the chapter
Type the line you want the player to say
Select the book you want to display
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one book in the chapter
Select the conversation you want to trigger
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one conversation in the chapter
Select the cutscene you want to trigger
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one cutscene in the chapter
Select the scene you want to trigger and the insertion point of the player
To add this type of effect, there must be at least one scene in the chapter
Select two effects and the probability with which the first one will be executed(%)
Select a scene to pick a destination point

In this panel you can edit the appearance of the element. In e-Adventure you can create different appearances for visual elements. Therefore the appearance will change according to the conditions specified for each block. Use the "Examine" buttons to select assets for the element, and the "Preview"/"Play" buttons to take a look at the selected assets.
Select an asset from the list
There are no assets for this category. Please add some assets with the managers in the "Adventure" menu of the main window
Hard map image of the scene
Set of slides of the slidescene
Image for the normal button state
Image for the button when the mouse is over it
Image for the button when it is pressed
Animation looking right used when the action is executed (optional)
Animation looking left used when the action is executed (optional)
When this mode is selected, the player is not painted in the game, as if the user were directly embedded in the game. This mode is suitable for the production of Myst-like adventure games.

When this mode is selected, the player is normally painted in the game, as another character of the adventure. This mode is suitable for the production of common point-and-click adventures, such as the Monkey IslandTM saga.
The scenes are the main element of an adventure. The player can move through the scene, and interact with the exits, items and characters that are placed in it.
Default initial position for the player
Use a default initial position in this scene
Edit the default initial position of the scene
Panel for the edition of the different appearances of the scene
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the scene
Allow to choose the player´s layer

The exits are areas defined in the scenes, from which the player can access to other areas. When the player moves to an exit, it can travel to another scene or cutscene, depending on the next scene that is defined and active in the exit.
Preview of the active areas location

The active areas are transparent, rectangular objects defined in the scenes. Those can be used to define portions of the scene which are interactuable. In this manner, when the mouse is over an active area the user could get some interaction from it
Preview of the barriers location and edition of the trajectory

The barriers are transparent, rectangular objects defined in the scenes. Those rectangles block the movement of the player when the conditions are validated as true. The trajectory is a set of nodes and sides that limit where the player can be and how he can get form one point to the other.
Position and size of the exit

Here you are allowed to customize the look of cursor shown when the mouse is over the exit, as well as the text displayed. Initially the default cursor is shown, and the text displayed will be the name of the scene you will get through this exit, so it is not compulsory to specify those values. However, you can customize both cursor and text for the exit (general case) and for each next scene. The text or cursor edited for the exit will only be used in case it was not customized for the next scene
Full description of the active area
Position and size of the active area
Brief description of the active area
Detailed description of the active area
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the active area
Position and size of the barrier
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the barrier
Use a destiny position for the player
Edit the destiny position for the player in the new scene

The element references are the elements that can be found in the scene. Each element is defined out of the scene, but can be added to scenes. For each reference, you can select where do you want to place the elements, and in which circumstances you want it to appear in the scene.
Full description of the referenced item
Create a new element reference (set, item or npc references are allowed)
Move up current reference changing its layer (making deeper)
Move down current reference changing its layer (making less deeper)
The element with layer "0" is the deepest element
Preview of the set items location

The set item references are the set items that can be found in the scene. Each set item is defined out of the scene, but can be added to a lot of scenes. For each reference, you can select where do you want to place the set items, and in which circumstances you want it to appear in the scene.
Full description of the referenced set item
Id of the referenced set item
Conditions of the set item reference
Position of the set item reference

The character references are the characters that can be found in the scene. Each character is defined out of the scene, but can be added to a lot of scenes. For each reference, you can select where do you want to place the character, and in which circumstances you want it to appear in the scene.
Full description of the referenced character

The cutscenes are often used to display data to the player in a non-interactive way. They can be used to present the prologue or epilogue of the adventure with text and images, as well as for another wide variety of uses.
The video format is not supported
An error occurred loading the video. Maybe the file is corrupt or the video format is not supported

The books are elements that can be shown during a game to display text information to the player. Here you can see a list of the current avalaible books, along with the number of paragraphs of each one.
Select the content type of the book
If this option is chosen, the book is build via attaching paragraphs with plain text or images. Other facilities supported are simple bullets and titles (text with a larger font size)
This type of book supports richer content: formatted text in RTF or HTML format. The disadvantage is the content files must be authored with an external tool
Use this panel for the edition of the documentation and background image of the book
Use this panel for the edition of the contents of the book
To see a full-screen preview of the book (as it will be rendered in the game), press the button below
This is a basic preview of the selected page.
Move the selected page one position up
Move the selected page one position down
When this option is selected, scroll bars will be used if the page provide does not fit in the screen
Use this slider to adjust the space between the page and the border of the background image
The URL provided is not accessible, so it is not guaranteed it will be shown in the game. Please, check you typed correctly the URL and your Internet connection is working properly.
There are problems with the formatted text file provided, so it might not be shown in the game
There are problems with the image format
There are no apparent problems with the content source provided.
When this type is selected you can provide the content from a local file, which will be added to the <e-Adventure> file
When this type is selected you must type the URL containing the content. Note therefore the page will be available as long as the URL is accessible
When this type is selected you must provide an image as the content for the page
Every book consists of a group of paragraphs, that are shown in order. These paragraphs represent plain text, titles, images, bullet paragraphs... and can be combined in any way.
NOTE: This is a low-quality preview of the book, the real appearance in the game may vary
Create a new paragraph (Title, Text, Bullet or Image are allowed)
Move the selected paragraph a position up
Move the selected paragraph a position down
Use these fields for the edition of the selected paragraph
Path to the image of the paragraph

The items are one of the principal elements that the player can interact with. They can be placed in the scenes, generated, consumed or placed in the inventory. Also, a wide variety of actions can be performed with the items.
Panel for the edition of the different looks of the item
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the item
The set items are elements that the player can´t interact with. They are merely decoratives items, and only they can be placed in scenes with this purpose.
Full description of the set item
Brief description of the set item
Detailed description of the set item
Graphical preview of the set item
Panel for the edition of the different looks of the set item
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the set item
No element reference has been selected
This is the player. For more information, please go to specific node. The initial position will be ignored if trayectories are used, or if in previous scene it was specified destination position.
Each item can have attached a set of actions, each one of them having a set of conditions and effects. These actions will be executed when the player interacts with the items.
Select an item to be the target of the action
There are no items defined in the chapter It's impossible to add an action of this type
Select a character to be the target of the action
There are no characters defined in the chapter It's impossible to add an action of this type
Panel for the personalization of the button
Panel for the configuration of conditions and effects of the button
Type the name of the custom action
Select the type of the custom action
Select whether the action is on the object or if it interacts with another
Select with what of whom the object interacts
Needs to get to the object
Distance to keep between player and objective
Set whether the player's character must move upto the object to perform the action
Color of the player's conversation lines
Panel for the edition of the different appearances of the player
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the player, including description, name and speech-text configuration

The characters take a very important role in every adventure. They can strike up conversations with the player, offering information or advice. They can interact with items also, receiving or giving items to the player.
Color of the character's conversation lines
Panel for the edition of the different appearances of the character
Panel for the edition of the documentation of the character, including description, name and speech-text configuration

Each character can have attached a set of conversation references. This way, when the player talks to the character, a certain conversation will be executed. Each conversation reference can have conditions, so it will be executed only in a specific state of the game.
Full description of the conversation reference

These conversations can be displayed when the player chooses to talk to a certain character, or during special events. These conversations have blocks of straight text, as well as parts where the player can choose an option, that will take some effect in the development of the conversation.
Are you sure that you want to add a child to the selected terminal node? If a child is added, the effects of this node will be deleted
Cannot move the selected node to the given position
Cannot link the selected node with the given node
Are you sure that you want to link this node to another one? If a link is added, the effect of this node will be deleted
Are you sure that you want to delete this node? The node will be deleted along with its children, if they have no links with the conversation. Deleted data will be permanently lost
Are you sure that you want to delete the link with the child? All nodes without a father node will be lost. Deleted data will be irrecoverable
Are you sure that you want to delete this option? All nodes without a father node will be lost. Deleted data will be irrecoverable
Are you sure that you want to add a go-back tag to the selected terminal node? If the tag is added, the effects of this node will be deleted
Status: Waiting destination node to move selected node
Status: Waiting destination node to be linked as a child with the selected node
Select the position in which the player will appear
This is a preview text line
Choose an image for the cursor
Choose an image for the button
Choose a rtf or html file
Here you can customize how the mouse looks for different events in the game. When not customized, default cursors will be used in the game.
This type of cursor is not allowed for current gui
Customize the cursor for different cases
This is the main cursor. When no other cursors are specified, this will be used
For contextual gui only: This cursor will be used when the mouse is over an element
For contextual gui only: This cursor will be used when an action is going to be performed
Cursor shown when the mouse is over an exit
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "use" actions
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "look" actions
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "talk" actions
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "examine" actions
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "grab" actions
For traditional gui only: This cursor will be used for "give" actions
Customize the buttons for different actions
Here you can customize how the action buttons look. When not customized, default buttons will be used in the game.
This is the normal talk button, the one shown when the mouse is not on it or clicking the action
This is the highlighted talk button, the one shown when the mouse is over it but not clicking
This is the pressed talk button, the one shown when the mouse is pressed inside the button
This is the normal use-grab button, the one shown when the mouse is not on or clicking the action
This is the highlighted use-grab button, the one shown when the mouse is over it but not clicking
This is the pressed use-grab button, the one show when the mouse is pressed inside the button
This is the normal examine button, the one shown when the mouse is not on or clicking the action
This is the highlighted examine button, the one show when the mouse is over it but not clicking
This is the pressed examine button, the one show when the mouse is pressed inside the button
Here you can customize how the arrows of the inventory look. When not customized, default arrows will be used in the game.
Customize the default elements of the inventory
This is the arrow in the left in its normal state.
This is the arrow in the left in its highlighted stated.
This is the arrow in the right in its normal state.
This is the arrow in the right in its highlighted stated.
Here you can customize how the mouse looks for different events in the game. When not customized, default cursors will be used in the game.

Use this section to edit a new assessment rule. In <e-Adventure> assessment rules are defined by the specification of a set of conditions (flags) that, when satisfied, make the game to set values to some properties. Therefore you can edit that conditions, as well as declare the properties to be set and its values. Moreover, you are allowed to type a brief concept for each rule, as well as a piece of text to be printed in the assessment report

In this section you will be able to edit a temporized assessment rule. These are similar to assessment rules, but they count the time between two events, defined by the sets of initial and end conditions. These rules support various effect blocks, so depending on the time range where the elapsed time fits the effect block will be different
These are all the assessment rules specified so far. You can edit whichever by browsing the tree and clicking on the specified rule.
Here you can find different mechanisms to provide feedback to the student. So far, you can only select to display the assessment report when the chapter is over.
Show assessment report when chapter is over
This section of the tree structure allows the creation and edition of new assessment profiles. To select which should be the active profile for the chapter use the combo box in the chapter panel

These are all the adaptation rules specified so far. You can edit whichever by browsing the tree and clicking on the specified rule. Moreover, you are allowed to modify the initial state fields in this panel.
This section of the tree structure allows the creation and edition of new adaptation profiles. To select which should be the active profile for the chapter use the combo box in the chapter panel

Use this section to edit a new adaptation rule. In <e-Adventure> adaptation rules are defined by linking a set of properties of the UoL deploying the game to a specified state of the game. Moreover, you are allowed to type a brief description for each rule.
The end: when the game reaches this next scene, the chapter will end.
If you press here the title and description of the Learning Object will be filled with the description and title provided for the adventure (using the menu bar)
The value introduced is not valid for {#0}. Please type a numeric positive value or leave it blank.
The state or condition this resource is in
The flow of interaction between this resource and the intended user
The degree of interactivity between the end user and this resource
Subjetive measure of this resource's usefulness as compared to its size or duration
Principal user for which this resource was designed
The principal environment within which the learning and use of this resource is intended to take place
It defines how hard it is to work through this resource for the typical target audience
learners late integration into the education system
learner with other specific educational support needs

creative commons: attribution - non commercial - share alike

To make correct LOMES Identifier's entry follow next indications: administration(abbreviation in lower case)_creation date(yearmonthday)_agregation level_nº of object, at least 7 digits(number smaller that 10.000.000)-meta
Note: "-meta" suffix is only required for Identifier in MetaMetaData
Example: es-ex_20061017_2_1300009-meta
Abbreviation for any spanish public administration(MEC, RED.ES, etc.) : es
Abbreviation for States (must carry "es" abbreviation):
es-an Andalucía es-ib Islas Baleares / Illes Balears es-ar Aragón es-lr La Rioja es-cl Castilla y León es-ma Comunidad de Madrid es-cm Castilla–La Mancha es-mu Región de Murcia es-ic Canarias es-na Navarra / Nafarroa es-ct Cataluña/Catalunya es-as Principado de Asturias es-ex Extremadura es-eu País Vasco / Euskadi es-ga Galicia es-cb Cantabria es-cv Comunidad Valenciana / Comunitat Valenciana

To make correct LOMES Contribute's entry follow next indications: When "Contribute Type" is “Content Provider”, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN: EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:ORG: "Company name" END:VCARD Note: "Company name" must be a non empty value, representing the name of company which privides this educational content.
When "Contribute Type" is “Publisher”, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN:Contenido digital educativo creado, catalogado y financiado con fondos FEDER dentro del expediente 714/07-LoteX EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:sugerencias@red.es ORG:RED.ES END:VCARD
When "Contribute Type" has other values, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION:3.0 FN: "Title" EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET: "example@yourmail.com" ORG: "Organization" END:VCARD Note: "Title", "example@yourmail.com" and "Organization" can be any value, even empty.

To make correct LOMES Contribute's entry follow next indications: When "Contribute Type" is “Creator”, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN: EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:ORG: "Company name" END:VCARD Note: "Company name" must be a non empty value, representing the name of company which privides this educational content.
When "Contribute Type" is “Validator”, the next value must appear in "Contribute Entity": BEGIN:VCARD VERSION 3.0 FN:Contenido digital educativo creado, catalogado y financiado con fondos FEDER dentro del expediente 714/07-LoteX EMAIL;TYPE=INTERNET:sugerencias@red.es ORG:RED.ES END:VCARD

Date Time must follow that pattern: AAAA[-MM[-DD[Thh[:mm[:ss[.s[IZH]]]]]]] where: AAAA=Year, expressed with 4 digits(>=0001) MM=Moth expressed with 2 digits (from 01 to 12) DD=Day expressed with 2 digits (from 01 to 31) hh=Hour expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 23)(am/pm it is not allowed) mm=Minute expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 59) ss=Seconds expressed with 2 digits (from 00 to 59) s=One or more digits for second tenth Time Zone identifier (“Z” for UTC or +hh:mm or –hh:mm)
Effects to be executed if the timer expires
Effects to be executed if the timer is stopped
Uses end conditions (if not, the timer will stop when start conditions aren't met)
Set -> If the timer is stopped, it will start again once the conditions to start are met Not set -> Once the timer stops it will not start again even if the conditions to start are met
Set -> The timer will run once and again until it is stopped Not set -> The timer will run once and stop.

Timers can be used to force the execution of a set of effects after a certain period of time. The timer is started when its "Start condition" becomes true. The timer will then start counting the indicated amount of time. When the timer expires, the effects block is executed. Timers can also have a "Stop condition". If this condition becomes true, the timer stops and can execute an alternative effects block.
Use this section of the tree to create and edit advanced features such as assessment and adaptation profiles and timers.

This is the list of global states defined in the chapter so far, along with the times each has been referenced. Global states are just groups of conditions, which can represent important "states" of the adventure games. They are specially useful when the same group of conditions is to be referenced more than once, as it avoids retyping.
The whole list of global states and global state references
List of conditions of the global state

This is the list of macros defined in the chapter so far, along with the times each has been referenced. Macros are just groups of effects, which can represent important functions to be executed in the adventure games. They are specially useful when the same group of effects is to be referenced more than once, as it avoids retyping.
The whole list of macros and macro references
List of effects of the macro
